title: BBC Local Live: Shropshire on Friday 14 July 2017 - BBC News
summary: muller looks to create 50 jobs in telford .
former teacher charged with historic sex offences .
no welshpool air show next year .
salzburg or hibernians await tns in champions league .

documents.title: good morning from the bbc shropshire newsroom
text: the team and i will be bringing you the latest news , sport , travel and weather between now and 18.00 .
you can comment on our stories and share your by email , facebook and twitter .
author: Les Walton
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: appeal to trace military medal owner
text: appeal to trace military medal owner

documents.title: historic station saved by volunteers
text: historic station saved by volunteers

documents.title: volunteers signal for fundraising help
text: volunteers signal for fundraising help

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on monday .

documents.title: primary school celebrates ofsted with a parade
text: children and teachers from newdale primary school have been parading through local streets this afternoon , to celebrate being rated outstanding by ofsted .
earlier , they sang songs on the school playing fields .
author: Paul Shuttleworth
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : hibernians or salzburg await winners of tns tie
text: the draw has been made for the third qualifying round of the champions league
if the new saints can beat the croatian champions hnk rijeka , they will face either salzburg of austria or hibernians of malta .
they were beaten 2-0 in the away leg and will attempt to turn that around in the home leg next week .

documents.title: watch : your 50-second weather forecast
text: after a bright and dry evening with sunny spells , the region will tend to cloud over during the night .
low cloud , rain and drizzle will reach the region by morning .
lows of 14c ( 57f ) .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: bravery awards for police officers who dealt with petrol incident
text: two police officers from telford who saved a woman who had been doused in petrol by a man threatening to set her on fire have been given police bravery awards .
pcs phil parke and steve bloomer managed to pull her to safety and bring the man under control , but suffered cuts and chemical burns in the process .
we must remember these are ordinary people with lives and families outside of work , who do extraordinary things to keep others safe .
i am very pleased to see them getting the recognition they deserve . ''

documents.title: gay wwii letters gain hollywood interest
text: gay wwii letters gain hollywood interest

documents.title: football : shrewsbury play villa and telford face wolves
text: both shrewsbury town and afc telford united face championship opposition tomorrow .
shrewsbury 's new-look side will be playing aston villa at the newly named montgomery waters meadow .
telford will be playing an under-23 side from wolves .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: fancy getting into motorsport ? # getinspired
text: here 's red bull team principal christian horner giving you five reasons why motorsport could suit you
and if you want to look into it further , take a look at the get inspired guide .

documents.title: no welshpool air show next year
text: there will be no welshpool air show next year , because the organisers are short of money .
the small airfield there has been putting on the shows since 2008 , working with the larger raf cosford air show to piggy-back on their displays .

the owner of the airfield , linda jones , said the show committee would meet next spring to decide whether to bring it back in 2019 , but explained that bad weather for the last two shows had hit their takings and that they would have to raise more money .
we have got a lot of fixed costs and we 've been really unlucky two consecutive years of poor weather , so we 've used our reserves . ''

documents.title: cricket : shropshire travelling to cornwall
text: shropshire travel to st austell this weekend for a three-day minor counties match against cornwall .

at the half-way point in the season they 're second in the western division table , 14 points behind leaders berkshire , but the teams are still closely bunched , with sixth-placed cornwall just eight points behind shropshire .
all-rounder tom weston , who used to play for bridgnorth , will be playing his first game of the season - he now plays club cricket in sussex .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: driver charged over schoolgirl death
text: driver charged over schoolgirl death

documents.title: petition calls for speed reduction on busy telford road
text: more than 90 people signed a petition to reduce the speed limit of a busy telford road , saying that they had put up with loud revving , fast speeds and dangerous driving for too long .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: your photos : grey cloud in telford and longnor
text: it 's remaining grey overhead , but we 're getting some great photos shared with us by the bbc weather watchers .
these ones were taken in telford ( top ) and longnor ( below ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: husband and wife sentenced for taking money from business
text: a husband and wife have been sentenced after pleading guilty to fraud and money laundering charges .

aimee purchase , 36 , from much wenlock , admitted fraud by abuse of a position of trust and was jailed for two years and eight months , while 38-year-old rikki james purchase pleaded guilty to money laundering and was given a two-year suspended sentence .
west mercia police said more than £ 100,000 had been laundered in all .

officers said mrs purchase was employed as a finance director for a stourbridge company and they found she had transferred money to accounts held by the couple , to fund their lifestyle and support mr purchase 's own business .
the force said both defendants would now also face proceedings to recover the assets they stole .

documents.title: former shrewsbury school teacher facing historic sex offence charges
text: a former shrewsbury school teacher has been charged with a series of sex attacks , dating back almost 40 years to his days teaching in west sussex .

gary dobbie , who is 66 and now lives in france , is charged with seven counts of indecent assault on a male , one count of attempted indecent assault on a male and three of indecent assault on a female .
he was suspended by shrewsbury school at the time of his arrest in january 2016 and left in six months later .
the school said : `` as far as we are aware these charges are in no way connected to shrewsbury school . ''
three other men , who also taught at christ 's hospital school in horsham are also charged with sex offences and he is due to appear in court next month .

documents.title: your photos : a cloudy morning in south shropshire
text: it 's been a cloudy start today and we 've had some great photos shared by bbc weather watchers in church stretton ( top ) and ludlow ( below ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: man charged with causing death of girl by dangerous driving
text: a man from shrewsbury has been charged with causing the death of an 11-year-old girl by dangerous driving .
roger thomas goodhall , 77 , from the mount was also charged with driving while above the limit for alcohol and failing to notify dvla of a medical condition .
his car hit olivia reeves on mytton oak road on 15 june .
he has been remanded in custody and will appear at telford magistrates ' court later today .

documents.title: two taken to hospital after separate crashes
text: a man in his 70s had to be cut free from his car last night after a crash involving a lorry , just off junction four of the m54 - the turn off for shifnal and priorslee .
it happened at 17:20 and he was taken to the princess royal hospital with an arm injury .
later in the evening , a 19-year-old woman also had to be cut free from her vehicle , after a two car crash on the a529 near market drayton .
she was taken to hospital in stoke with back , shoulder and abdominal pain .

documents.title: muller looks to create 50 jobs with telford expansion
text: muller is planning to create 50 new jobs with the expansion of its donnington wood site in telford .
the company has put an application in to the borough council and if it gets approval , it says it will be able to double its production of 350 million pots of yoghurt a year to 700 million .

documents.title: petition launched against market drayton car parking changes
text: an online petition has been launched against plans to radically shake-up parking charges in market drayton .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: tai chi festival at lilleshall
text: lilleshall is hosting an international tai chi festival over the next few days .
it 's taking place at the national sports centre and will feature demonstrations with 200 performers .
organisers say the chinese practice can help people recover from strokes , heart attacks and post-traumatic stress disorder .

documents.title: council gives more detail on 50th anniversary spending
text: telford and wrekin council has been giving more details about how it plans to spend £ 2m set aside to celebrate the town 's 50th birthday .

half of the cash will be made available for community projects to permanently mark the occasion and the other half will go to on everyday projects , such as buying a new minibus or refitting a kitchen in a village hall .
the authority has already announced it will be running an online lottery , with a weekly draw , to raise money for good causes in the area .
and it says it is planning a series of events for next year .

documents.title: telford 50th logo to be revealed tomororrow
text: the winning logo for telford 's 50th anniversary celebrations will be revealed at the town 's festival of giants in southwater tomorrow .
nearly 5,000 people voted on the three options out forward by telford and wrekin council in an online poll .
the authority has a series of events planned to mark the anniversary and has set aside £ 2m to spend on a range of projects .

documents.title: football : semi final line-up decided for shropshire senior cup
text: the new saints beat market drayton town 2-0 in the shropshire senior cup last night .
goals from farleigh and draper secured a home semi final against afc telford united .
the other semi final will be between shrewsbury town and shawbury , who beat haughmond 2-0 on wednesday night .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: your comments : unhappiness at planned roadworks
text: the announcement that work on shrewsbury 's english bridge gyratory is going to start at the end of the month has provoked a lot of comment on bbc radio shropshire 's facebook page .
heather maskill wrote : `` shrewsbury council are killing town .
footfall is down since the reabrook road works and this is another nail in the coffin .
i can totally understand why people will go elsewhere but for small independents like myself , this is going to be a nightmare . ''
chris day was also unhappy about the work being carried out and commented : `` it 's not broken .
so why spend tax payers money on `` fixing '' it ?
is it so they can can say they 've done things to improve the town ? ''

and phillip smith agreed , saying it was `` wasting money which could be put to better use what about putting the money back into services for the elderly and the young - and my drive needs doing '' .

documents.title: ice hockey : defenceman weaver returns for tigers
text: telford tigers have re-signed key defenceman jonathan weaver for the new season .
the 40-year-old has played for 11 different teams in his career , including the tigers , and is a current great britain international .
head coach tom watkins , who also coaches the gb team , says he is `` one of the best british players of this generation , if not the best .
it 's as simple as that '' .
we have now retained eight guys from last season 's team , plus guys with both elite and epl experience .
then you add a jonathan weaver to the mix , a current gb international , who was part of the gold-medal winning team in april .
i think that 's a pretty exciting team for the fans to get behind . ''
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: council in new call for jeremy hunt to intervene on a & e
text: telford & wrekin council bosses will again call for health secretary jeremy hunt to intervene in plans for the future of shropshire 's hospitals .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: three months of work on shrewsbury gyratory to come
text: once the reabrook roundabout revamp is finished , contractors will turn their attentions to the english bridge gyratory system .

the project , due to start on 31 july , is scheduled to take three months and will include resurfacing work , alterations to footpaths , cycle paths and changes to the traffic lights and pedestrian crossings .
it is the latest in a line of major works in shrewsbury , including the recently completed meole brace roundabout , that have frustrated many drivers .

documents.title: roundabout works delayed by drains
text: work at shrewsbury 's reabrook roundabout has been delayed because of underground drains , shropshire council says .
traffic lights were put in two months ago , blocking the town 's inner ring-road , and they 're now expected to remain there until the end of the month .
there 's finite amounts of information before we go below the ground .
we only really know the day we pull the turf off exactly what 's there . ''

documents.title: video : what 's the weather got in store today ?
text: after a cloudy start with the chance of some drizzle , it should brighten up this afternoon with some sunny spells in store .
it will feel quite warm in the sunshine this afternoon , with top temperatures of 20c ( 68f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: welcome to our live updates for the day
text: welcome to live updates from bbc shropshire on friday morning .
we 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email , tweet us on @ twitterid or message via facebook .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: west mercia police withdraws from motorway patrol group
text: west mercia police has decided to take over responsibility for patrolling motorways itself and is pulling out of the central motorways police group ( cmpg ) .
the force said it wanted to `` ensure more locally based and more community focused arrangements '' for its sections of the m5 , m42 , m50 and m54 .
the cmpg was set up in 1990 , to jointly patrol the regions motorways and was made up of a number of forces , including west midlands , staffordshire and warwickshire .

i have made the significant decision for west mercia police to withdraw from the central motorway policing group as i believe it to be the best way forward for how we police our motorways and roads across our force area in the coming years . ''
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : new telford manager to meet fans
text: afc telford united fans will get a chance to meet their new manager and ask him questions at an open training session next month .
rob edwards will be joined by his assistant sean parrish and club chairman andy pryce on 3 august and players will also be available to sign autographs after a squad photo-session .

documents.title: weather for tonight and tomorrow
text: after a largely dry and bright evening , there may be some showers at times overnight .
however , many places will stay dry and mild with some clear spells - lows of 15c ( 59f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: parking charges plan for gobowen railway station
text: commuters could be forced to pay to park at a shropshire railway station for the first time under new charges proposed by shropshire council .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: council fraudster to pay back £ 14,000
text: council fraudster to pay back £ 14,000

documents.title: work on english bridge gyratory to start at the end of the month
text: work to redevelop the gyratory system next to shrewsbury 's english bridge will start on 31 july , shropshire council has announced .
the project is scheduled to take three months and will include resurfacing work , alterations to footpaths , cycle paths and changes to the traffic lights and pedestrian crossings .
it 's part of a wider programme of work around the town and it is timed to start after the completion of work on the reabrook roundabout .

documents.title: shopkeeper finds 192-year-old message on wall
text: a shop owner in shrewsbury has found a 192-year-old message written on one of her walls , while she was carrying out renovation work .
it appears to have been left by a previous decorator and reads `` this room was papered july 4th 1825 by timothy white , assisted by h crump/crield '' .
michelle gilchrist , who only recently opened the store on wyle cop , is now trying to find out more about the person who left the message .
we were stripping back the walls so we could paint and the last thing we expected to find was a note from 192 years ago . ''

documents.title: telford councillors hit out at hospital trust again
text: the people in charge of shropshire 's hospitals are coming under fire from telford and wrekin councillors again .

they 're unhappy about proposals to move specialist women and children 's services to shrewsbury and to downgrade telford 's accident and emergency department , and will discuss a motion of no confidence in the leadership of shrewsbury and telford hospital trust on 20 july .

the councillors are also angry that the hospitals have set out a timetable suggesting consultation on the plans should start in september , saying it pre-judges a yet-to-be published review of the process so far .
the motion going before councillors will also call on the hospitals to do more to hire extra consultants .
this is an nhs trust in crisis with a mounting catalogue of problems in how it is managing services now and in the future . ''

documents.title: maternity review 'should answer financial questions '
text: the health service says its review of maternity services in the county should explain why it was costing nearly £ 1m a year more than expected .

the county 's three rural maternity units , in ludlow , bridgnorth and oswestry , are running a limited service at the moment , following a series of staffing problems and the review is expected to come up with a series of recommendations this autumn .
campaigners have said they fear the units will never reopen and last weekend hundreds of people attended a protest in oswestry .
the shrewsbury and telford hospital trust says the closures will last no longer than six months .
i fully understand why people are so passionate about it , these are people they care about having their babies and they do n't want anything to go wrong .
i think the thing i would want to say is we 're on the same side . ''

documents.title: your comments : indifference towards change of stadium name
text: the announcement that shrewsbury town 's new stadium has a new sponsor and a new name - the montgomery waters meadow - has been met with indifference by many fans , commenting on bbc radio shropshire 's facebook page .
dale skitt wrote : `` nice of them to put the money in but it 'll always be just the meddah to me .
only the press and media will use the full title . ''
paul edge agreed and added : `` it does n't bother me to be fair what it 's called long as shrewsbury are getting money '' .
and robert tomlins commented : `` nobody will actually call it that , so it 's a big fat `` so what '' from me . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: watch : restoration work to start on station buildings
text: a community group says it will cost more than £ 200,000 to restore the railway station buildings at gobowen and make them available for use again .

the gobowen area improvement project says the main station building , which was built in 1846 , is a `` real gem '' and that its design makes it look `` more like an italian villa than a railway station '' .
author: Paul Shuttleworth
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: shrewsbury bidding to host substance abuse walk
text: shrewsbury is bidding to host a `` recovery walk '' next year , for people who have had issues with substance abuse .
the annual event is organised by the addiction charity favor uk and this year 's event in blackpool is expected to attract more than 8,000 people .
the town is up against bradford to host a walk in september next year , which will be the 10th anniversary of the event .

documents.title: warning about scammers claiming to be council staff
text: people in the telford and wrekin area are being warned to be on their guard against scammers claiming to be from the council 's children 's services .
the authority says a number of households have received phone calls and it is investigating
it said it has no connection with the company making the calls .

documents.title: ice hockey : miller returns to tigers for ninth season
text: joe miller is returning to the telford tigers for a ninth season , the club has announced .
the 32-year-old has made over 600 senior appearances for the tigers , manchester phoenix , peterborough phantoms and basingstoke bison , including more than 50 in the elite league .
head coach tom watkins said miller had `` all the tools to be one of the leading offensive players in the league '' .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: open water lessons for children across the midlands
text: hundreds of schoolchildren are getting a taste of open water by outdoor swimming this week , in an effort to keep them safe over the summer holidays .
the swimsafe initiative usually takes place near the coast , but for the first time ever it 's being done in birmingham 's salford park .
it involves pupils from across the midlands , who are being taught the perils of the open water such as cold water shock and currents .
author: Amy Cole
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: your photos : summer 's day in hopton heath and longnor
text: we 've had some stunning photos of shropshire shared by the bbc weather watchers today , including these ones taken near hopton heath ( top ) and longnor ( below ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: aircraft 's 'nosedive ' crash inquiry
text: aircraft 's 'nosedive ' crash inquiry

documents.title: garden centre go-ahead for oswestry site after appeal
text: a new garden centre will be built on the edge of oswestry , creating up to 70 new jobs , after planning inspectors allowed an appeal by the developer .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: gobowen station could cost over £ 200k to restore
text: a community group which has bought the buildings at gobowen station says they could cost over £ 200,000 to restore .
some of the grade ii listed station buildings date back to the 1840s and the gobowen area improvement group wants them to be managed by local people .
it is fundraising and looking for grants to pay for the work .
author: Paul Shuttleworth
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: your photos : light cloud and blue skies around shropshire
text: we 're forecast another fine day in shropshire , with a little light cloud around .
and that 's being seen in the photos shared by the bbc weather watchers .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: museum has offers from around the world since finding gay letters
text: oswestry town museum says it 's had offers from `` all around the world '' since it discovered a collection of love letters between two gay soldiers .

historian mark hignett said they 'd bought nearly a 1,000 letters addressed to gilbert bradley ( below ) , not knowing at first that his lover was another man , thinking the letters would give an insight into the army training that went on in the area .

after the publicity surrounding the discovery of the letters earlier this year , mr hignett said he 'd had interest from film producers , tv documentary makers , book publishers and even a men 's choral group from mississippi , all wanting to re-tell the story .
i have a folder of interested people from across the world and they cover every spectrum of the arts . ''
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: forklift trucks damaged in stafford park fire
text: there was a fire at a business on the stafford park industrial estate in telford last night .
two forklift trucks and a quantity of stock were damaged .
the fire service were alerted by an automatic fire alarm .

documents.title: football : telford beaten by aston villa
text: afc telford united 's first match with rob edwards in charge ended in defeat last night .
they were beaten 4-0 by aston villa in a friendly at the bucks head .
their next match will be at home against a wolves under-23 side on saturday .

documents.title: gay ww2 soldiers ' letters to inspire national celebration of letter-writing
text: the love letters between two gay soldiers during world war two , which were uncovered by oswestry town museum , are to be the inspiration for a national love-letter writing event ,

heritage open days is asking people to write their own letters between 7 and 10 september and then hand them in to be ceremonially burned and then turned into a diamond , which will go on display in oswestry .
the organisation says that since the letters were discovered , the museum has had `` book offers , invitations from composers and requests for exclusivity from film producers '' .

documents.title: online lottery plan to be discussed
text: telford and wrekin council 's looking at starting an online lottery scheme , to help charities and community groups raise more money .
the council 's acknowledged that fundraising grants have been hard to come by - and wants to give charities a boost .
cash prizes from £ 25 up to £ 25,000 would be available through the draw .
the idea will be discussed at a cabinet meeting today and the authority 's aim is to launch the project as part of its 50th anniversary celebrations next year .

documents.title: riat : jack the pet goose 'loves watching the planes '
text: a shropshire family visiting the royal international air tattoo at raf fairford told bbc radio gloucestershire 's mark smith how they take their eight-year-old pet goose - jack - everywhere with them .
he loves watching the aircraft and apparently his favourite display is the red arrows .

documents.title: community groups told to drop interest in running quarry pool
text: groups interested in taking over the running of the quarry swimming pool in shrewsbury have been told to drop the idea .
the authority 's new leader peter nutting says his preferred option is to keep it within the loop of the river severn .

documents.title: trucks and stock damaged in fire at telford firm
text: two forklift trucks and a pallet of stock have been damaged by fire at a telford business .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: council welcomes sentence for ex-employee
text: shropshire council has welcomed a court 's decision to hand a former employee a suspended jail term after she stole thousands of pounds from the authority .
a judge at shrewsbury crown court gave penelope wilkinson a 12-month sentence , suspended for two years .
she 's also agreed to repay nearly £ 14,000 after admitting a fraud charge , uncovered during a review of accounts at an old council-run company called ip & e .
the court heard wilkinson claimed cash to pay invoices for a printing firm .
shropshire council declined to comment on any policy changes which have been put in place since this case arose .
author: Tim Page
News Editor, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: microlight 'did not recover ' after stalling
text: the air accidents investigation branch has published its report into a fatal microlight crash in shropshire last year .
the pilot tony crocombe and his passenger michael sumner , both from market drayton , were killed after the light aircraft plummeted from the sky near shifnal .
the microlight was coming into land when witnesses say it went into a steep turn at low speed causing it to stall and possibly spin .
the investigation found there had been accidents involving 16 microlights of its type since 1994 - as a result safety action is being taken by the light aircraft association .

documents.title: video : what 's the weather got in store today ?
text: there will be some showers around this morning before a dry and bright afternoon with top temperatures of 21c ( 70f ) .
you can find a detailed forecast for your area on the bbc weather site .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: good morning from bbc shropshire
text: i 'm taking a look at the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
you can comment on our stories and share your by email , facebook or twitter .
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: football : new striker heard good things about shrewsbury town
text: it 's become a bit of a cliche , but new shrewsbury town signing carlton morris says he agreed to join on loan after hearing good things about the manager , the town and the football club .

carlton scored eight goals on loan at hamilton in the 2015-16 season , but will be looking to find that scoring touch again after failing to find the net during his loan spell at rotherham last season .

documents.title: over 1,000 indecent exposure incidents since 2010
text: over 1,000 reports of indecent exposure have been investigated by police in warwickshire and west mercia since 2010 .
the peak came in 2015 , when there were 61 incidents reported in the warwickshire area and 144 in shropshire , herefordshire and worcestershire .
in total there have been 1,285 reports , 384 of those in warwickshire and there has been no clear trend - upwards or downwards .

documents.title: watch : your 50-second weather
text: it will remain dry overnight with largely clear skies and light winds leading to a cooler night than of late , especially in rural parts - lows of 15c ( 59f ) .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: attempt to rob midwife outside hospital
text: police have released a cctv image of a man they want to speak to after an attempt to rob a midwife outside telford 's princess royal hospital .
the woman in her 50s was approached by a man who demanded her car keys at 21:30 on monday , but she refused and went into the hospital to raise the alarm .
police say she was shaken but unhurt and the hospital told the shropshire star : `` we are appalled that one of our midwives has been threatened in such a terrifying manner at the end of a shift . ''

documents.title: football : west brom added to shrewsbury 's cup group
text: west brom 's under-23 side has been added to shrewsbury town 's group in the checkatrade trophy , joining coventry city and walsall .
the group stages are played as a round-robin format with the top two teams progress to the knock-out rounds .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: medieval key used to break into abbey
text: a medieval-style key is thought to have been used by thieves to break into the abbey in shrewsbury .
police say they got into the church sometime between 18:00 on friday and 10:00 on saturday and got away with an amount of money , taking the key with them .
the key had been reported missing before the burglary and police believe the thieves used it , because there was no sign of a forced entry .

documents.title: cricket : weston added to shropshire squad
text: tom weston will make his first appearance of the season for shropshire in their minor counties match in cornwall this weekend .
he top scored for shropshire 's development xi , with 69 from 75 balls , in their last match against staffordshire at wrekin college .
weston will replace dillon pennington , who is unavailable for the game , in the only change to the side which beat oxfordshire by eight wickets at shifnal earlier this month .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: icymi - 'tennis saved my life ' # getinspired
text: in case you missed it in yesterday 's coverage , this is a great story about how tennis can transform lives .
four years ago tony costa from llandudno in north wales weighed 26-and-a-half stone , having struggled to deal with the death of his five-month-old son .
he lost some weight through a diet club but had `` plateaued '' and was `` losing interest '' and needed something to keep him going .
`` tennis came at the right time , '' tony says .
this year tony 's son would 've been 20 years old and he and his wife caroline held a memorial tennis match at a local club .
`` we shone some light on some darkness - and we have tennis to thank for that . ''
if you want to follow tony 's lead and get into tennis , read our get inspired guide .

documents.title: police commissioner denies accusations of 'empire building '
text: the police commissioner for west mercia has denied accusations of `` empire building '' from the leader of shropshire council .

speaking about plans to merge the fire authority with the office of the police and crime commissioner , councillor peter nutting said : `` i 'm a bit disturbed about it , because it does seem to me that it is just john campion trying to build his empire even bigger than it already is . ''
he also questioned whether it would produce significant savings .
john campion responded by saying the proposals were being made `` in the best interests of the service '' and that he was not an `` ego maniac '' .
and he suggested that resistance from the fire authorities and local councils was simply an attempt at self-preservation .
i do understand why those i am seeking to abolish would be concerned about it .
i 'm not daft , i get that . ''

documents.title: search for woman who helped assault victim
text: police want to talk to a good samaritan who helped a woman who was attacked at telford 's central bus station on monday .
they say the 40-year-old victim was punched in the face at around 16:00 and that another woman at the bus station helped her escape her attacker .
a 51-year-old man from telford has been arrested on sus of assault abh in connection with the attack and he is being held in police custody .

documents.title: football : telford face villa in friendly
text: afc telford united have a friendly match against aston villa at the bucks head tonight .
it will be the first home game for new manager rob edwards .
shrewsbury town also have a friendly against villa at their oteley road stadium on saturday .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: your photos : sunshine in newport and all stretton
text: it 's brightened up a bit today , and we 've seen some sunshine in the photos from the bbc weather watchers .
these ones were taken in newport ( top ) and all stretton ( below ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: breakingcouncil worker avoids jail after admitting £ 14k fraud
text: a former shropshire council worker has avoided going to jail , despite taking almost £ 14,000 from the authority after faking invoices .
penelope wilkinson , otherwise known as rhian huxley , was given a suspended jail term after admitting the charge of fraud by abuse of position .
shrewsbury crown court was told she had agreed to repay the full sum from her pension fund .
the court heard she claimed cash to pay fake invoices for a printing firm .

judge jim tindal told the former press officer she 'd been put in a position of trust which she abused and on top of the suspended jail term , wilkinson will have to carry out 150 hours of unpaid community work .
author: Tim Page
News Editor, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: business group fears car parking changes will 'drive people out '
text: an organisation that represents more than 500 shrewsbury companies says it is `` deeply concerned '' by proposed changes to car parking charges , put forward by shropshire council .
the changes would include a move to a fixed hourly rate and fee-increases for some car parks .

the shrewsbury business improvement district group said the proposals `` will drive people out of town '' and suggested that other measures could be taken to reduce congestion and pollution , such as electric charging points for cars and the introduction of more park and ride services .
we are concerned that some of the large pricing increases proposed by shropshire council are not appropriate for a market town , and will lead to people choosing to go elsewhere .
many businesses in the town are already having to come to terms with increased business rates and this proposal would add further pressure to business owners and their staff . ''

documents.title: work on canal to remove old railway embankment
text: volunteers are out by the montogomery canal this morning attempting to remove a railway embankment near pant that 's holding up restoration work .
the railway line there has n't been used since 1965 and people have to use steps to get over the embankment .
the project is expected to take a week .

documents.title: three arrests after shrewsbury drugs raid
text: three men have been arrested in a drug raid in the ditherington area of shrewsbury , following concerns raised by local residents .
police say they recovered £ 1,000 along with class a drugs and narcotic paraphernalia .
two men aged 46 and 37 were arrested on sus of possessing heroine and a 19-year-old was arrested on sus of the possession and intent to supply cocaine .
they 've all been bailed for a month .

documents.title: unemployment up in the west midlands
text: the unemployment rate in the west midlands has risen by 6,000 , bringing the total number of unemployed people to 166,000 .
according to the office for national statistics ( ons ) , that equates to 5.9 % of the west midlands population being out of work .
nationally , uk unemployment fell by 64,000 to 1.49 million in the three months to may .
it meant the unemployment rate fell to its lowest since 1975 , at 4.5 % , the office for national statistics ( ons ) added .
author: Monica Rimmer
Journalist, BBC Online

documents.title: loton park hill climb competitors to benefit from resurfaced track
text: competitors at this weekend 's loton park hill climb will literally be trying hard to 'keep it on the black stuff ' as the whole track has been completely resurfaced for the first time in well over two decades .
author: Shropshire Live

documents.title: police commissioner says 20mph zones 'just do n't work '
text: the police and crime commissioner for west mercia says he does n't think 20mph zones work in town centres .
the idea is being considered in both ludlow and shifnal , where `` 20 is plenty '' banners have been put up , encouraging drivers to slow down .
campaigners in the towns say traffic calming measures like speed bumps and limited 20mph zones are unpopular and do n't solve the problem .
but , mr campion told a bbc radio shropshire phone-in drivers are more likely to respond to changes to the road layout and a `` one size fits all '' approach requires extra effort to enforce .

blanket , arbitrary imposition of 20mph zones just do n't work across large urban areas , they work outside schools , they work in small sections of town centres , but blanket zones have been shown just do n't work . ''

documents.title: football : new name for shrewsbury town stadium
text: shrewsbury town 's stadium has got a new name for its oteley road stadium - the montgomery waters meadow .
the new stadium sponsor , church stoke-based montgomery waters , says it will also be selling its `` range of naturally sourced healthy hydration products '' to fans in the ground .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: football : tactical changes improved performance says tns boss
text: the new saints manager scott ruscoe says he saw signs of improvement in the second half of their champions league qualifier against hnk rijeka last night .
he made a number of tactical changes after half time saying his side had `` no outlet '' in the first half and he responded by pushing striker scott quigley further forward .
tns ended up losing the match 2-0 , but ruscoe said `` i think it did help us and we did grow into the game '' after the changes .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: shopping centre plans to be discussed in secret
text: a secret report going to shropshire council today is believed to be about redeveloping shrewsbury 's three town centre shopping centres .
the item will be discussed in private behind closed doors , with the conservative-run authority saying this is to protect businesses involved .
a £ 2m plan to transform the town 's bus station could also be discussed .
author: Joanne Gallacher
Political reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: road widening plans in shropshire for hs2 traffic
text: roads in a shropshire village could be widened to accommodate construction traffic for hs2 .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: forty five air gun attacks on shropshire animals since 2012
text: there were 13 air gun attacks on animals in shropshire last year and the county has seen 45 attacks in the last five years , according to figures obtained by the bbc .
across england and wales , there were nearly 900 of these incidents last year and the rspca says cats and birds are the most common targets .
the attacks include one in 2014 on snowy , a cat from tern hill ( above ) , who got a pellet lodged in her head .
snowy survived , but vets said it was lucky and the mother of her owner , jill turner said she was worried , because the pellet could have hit a car or even a child .
author: Genevieve Tudor
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : shrewsbury manager unhappy with brackley defeat
text: shrewsbury town manager paul hurst was n't happy with the effort from some of his players in their 2-1 defeat to brackley town last night .
he used 21 players in the match and alex rodman scored for shrewsbury in the last 10 minutes .
in an interview with the club 's website , hurst said some of his players were `` lacking '' in desire .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: football : the new saints beaten in croatia
text: the new saints lost 2-0 away to the croatian champions hnk rijeka in their champions league qualifier last night .
they fell behind after just four minutes and conceded a second on 68 minutes .
the second leg will be played next tuesday at oswestry 's park hall stadium .
it was disappointing to concede quite early on and i think after that we defended really well , and played well at times .
we had chances at the end and if we could have nicked a goal it would have been all to play for . ''
author: Nick Southall
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: concerns about increased car park charges
text: a group representing hundreds of shrewsbury companies says it has concerns about shropshire council 's plans to increase the price of on-street parking .
if approved , it will go up in the town centre by more than 50 % from £ 1.60 an hour to £ 2.50 .
the shrewsbury bid group say they 're worried the new prices could drive people out of town .
the move will be discussed at a council cabinet meeting today .
if councillors agree with the proposal , it 'll go out to consultation .

documents.title: shirehall unison managers still suspended
text: it has been four months since three senior managers of the shropshire branch of the unison trade union were suspended over claims of financial irregularities .
the three people in question are shropshire unison branch secretary alan james , vice chair karen scardifeld and treasurer janice louch - who all deny the allegations .
all three sit on the branch 's finance committee and they were based at the shirehall in shrewsbury .
shropshire understands they 've had no contact with unison since their suspension on 16 march and do n't know the exact details of what they are accused of .
of the three people suspended two have their wages paid for by shropshire council and they 're seconded to the union .
since their suspension they have been working at the shirehall .
a spokesman for the authority said they could n't comment on the matter at this time and that this was an internal union issue .
unison have refused to comment .
author: Joanne Gallacher
Political reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: shrewsbury gang beat man with metal bars and wrenches
text: a man who ignored the chat up lines of a teenager was set upon by a gang of up to 20 people after she called for them to come and bang '' him out , a court was told .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: council considering licensing scheme
text: telford and wrekin council wants to introduce `` selective licensing '' meaning landlords would have to pay to rent out homes in seven areas of the borough .

the council could demand that anyone who wants to put their home up for rent in hadley , leegomery , malinslee , hollinswood , brookside , sutton hill and woodside pays £ 610 per property , as well as adhere to certain conditions .
the council believes it would improve standards and reduce anti-social behaviour .
author: Alex Seftel
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: watch : your 50-second weather forecast
text: it will be a fine day with plenty of sunny spells , these perhaps becoming more prolonged during the afternoon and evening .
with light winds it will feel much warmer than on tuesday - highs of 21c ( 70f ) .
author: Rich Davis
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: good morning from the bbc shropshire newsroom
text: the team and i will be bringing you the latest news , sport , travel and weather between now and 18:00 .
you can comment on our stories and share your by email , facebook or twitter .
author: Les Walton
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on wednesday .

documents.title: bridgnorth roadworks get under way
text: work on the a458 bridgnorth bypass is starting today and is scheduled to continue until 10 november .
shropshire council is starting at the stourbridge road and kidderminster road roundabouts with temporary traffic lights set up to control traffic for the next two or three weeks .
at the same time work will be carried out on the bridge which carries the road over the river severn , with traffic lights up until friday to allow workmen to erect scaffolding .

documents.title: weather : more rain to come in the west midlands
text: the rain should clear up overnight and it will be a lot dryer tomorrow , but there will be lots of cloud around .
author: Rich Davis
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: raf cosford given freedom of birmingham
text: raf cosford has been granted the freedom of the city of birmingham this afternoon .
the city council voted to confer the honour which gives the base the right to parade through the streets with `` drums beating , bands playing colours flying and bayonets fixed '' .
it is the 12th military unit to be given the status since world war two and the council said it was in recognition of the close links the base , which trains aircraft engineers , has with the city .
it is the first raf station to receive the honour .

documents.title: region has more than 4,000 people with organ transplants
text: more than 4,000 people in the west midlands owe their lives to organ transplants .
nhs blood and transplant says the number of people on the organ donor register has increased by 27 % over the past five years .
it says despite the rise there is still a shortage of donors .
find out more on the nhs website .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: bridgnorth swimming pool open again
text: after 10 months and £ 300,000 , bridgnorth 's only community swimming pool is open to the public again .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: football : tns opponents are an ambitious club
text: the new saints are facing a croatian side on the rise in their champions league qualifier tonight .
last season hnk rijeka brought to an end dinamo zagreb 's record of 11 successive league titles and they now have their sights set on success in europe .
croatian football commentator korvdo vujanovic has been telling us more about the club .
author: Nick Southall
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: your comments : bank closure 'sad but inevitable '
text: barclays ' decision to close its branch in shifnal has been is a sad moment for many of the people commenting on bbc radio shropshire 's facebook page .
june windsor wrote : `` started my first job here in 1955 .
loved every minute .
sad for me to see it go . ''
and andy huxley added : `` some of us rely on the branches for paying cheques in - what are we supposed to do ? ''
but others saw it as being inevitable , with andrew finch writing : `` bank transfers online are done in secs , loans approved or declined online in secs , no future in high street banks . ''
and alison jackson commented : `` i suspect the branch is busy , but not with the sort of business that creates revenue for that branch . ''
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: battersea contract for telford brickmaker
text: a telford company has won a contract to supply 422,000 bricks for the restoration of battersea power station .
blockeys from trench lock said its bricks were used when the east side of the building was constructed in 1957 and they won the job after supplying materials for an earlier restoration job .
group managing director frank hanna said it would n't result in any extra jobs , but was a `` high profile job '' which would `` highlight the capability of the workforce '' .
author: Les Walton
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : shrewsbury add another striker
text: shrewsbury town have signed another striker , 21-year-old carlton morris from norwich .
he has joined on a season-long loan after spending part of last season at rotherham .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: arrest after suspected attempt to abduct boys
text: a 31-year-old man has been arrested after what police suspect was an attempt to abduct two young boys in telford .
officers were called at 13:35 yesterday to reports that the man from telford had beckoned to the pair outside a shop in the brookside area of town and he remains in police custody .
the two boys were unhurt and no attempt had been made to touch them in any way .

documents.title: cheerleaders win place in world championships
text: cheerleaders from telford have won a place at the cheerleading world championships in florida next year .
cheerforce odyssey got there by taking part in a european competition held in liverpool .
the world championships take place in orlando in april .
it 's every cheerleader 's goal to go to worlds .
everyone in our gym from the six-year-old minis to our senior athletes are buzzing from this recent success . ''

documents.title: funding target reached for stiperstones project
text: natural england has raised the £ 17,000 it needs to restore part of the stiperstones .
it plans to remove conifers from the 1.3 hectare area known as bergum wood and replace them with native oak trees .
natural england has thanked people for their donations to the appeal and says they will have more opportunities to help when the clearing and planting begins .

documents.title: shrewsbury sign norwich 's morris on loan
text: shrewsbury sign norwich 's morris on loan

documents.title: rabbits 'dumped like rubbish ' by roadside
text: the rspca says six rabbits were found `` dumped like rubbish '' by the side of the a49 at sansaw .
one of them died shortly afterwards , but the remaining five are being looked after by the charity .
the charity said it was available to help if pet owners get into difficulties and said there was no excuse for abandoning animals .
we seem to be living in a throwaway society where people just dump young animals when they either do n't have the resources to care for them or do n't know how , or just do n't want to anymore .
it is so upsetting to see .
there is no excuse for abandoning any animal in this way . ''

documents.title: football : shrewsbury town face brackley in friendly
text: shrewsbury town travel to northamptonshire tonight , for a friendly against brackley town .
they finished seventh in the national league north last season - the same division afc telford united play in .
it will be shrewsbury 's first pre-season game in this country after their recent training camp in portugal and a chance for fans to see some of the players who have signed this summer .

documents.title: your photos : thick cloud and rain in july
text: it 's not looking very pleasant outside and the bbc weather watchers have been sharing their photos of thick grey cloud and rain .
these were taken in longnor ( top ) and telford ( below ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: wrekin cafe to open within weeks
text: a man who bought the halfway house cafe on the wrekin says it could be open to the public in two weeks ' time .
sean saward , who bought the property three-and-a-half years ago , says the project is almost complete .
mr saward wanted to restore the cafe to its former glory , and despite it being more difficult and expensive than he thought , he has no regrets .

the roof had to come off , two gable ends had gone , so when you 've taken those out of the equation there 's not much left , but that 's what we did and we 've built it up from that again and we 've tried to do it as sympathetically as possible . ''
author: Elliot Hawkins
BBC West Midlands

documents.title: mothers asked for experiences of maternity units
text: an nhs review of the county 's maternity units wants to hear the experiences of shropshire mothers .
it wants to hear from women who have used the service in the last two-and-a-half years .
there 's a meeting at bridgnorth community hospital this afternoon from 13.30 and over the coming days there 'll be more in telford , shrewsbury , ludlow and oswestry .
author: Elaine Muir
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: ice hockey : veteran plant returns for telford tigers
text: experienced forward rick plant is returning for a seventh season with the telford tigers .

the team is preparing for its first season in the national ice hockey league , following the collapse of the english premier league and plant said he was looking forward to the `` unknown challenge in a new league '' .
tigers head coach tom watkins described as a `` winner '' who `` brings that winning attitude with him '' .
he is obviously a very experienced guy , does n't get fazed at all and is pretty laid back , but underneath there is a determination to win , and be as good as he can be every night .
he turns up every game and is happy to have a ton of responsibility on his shoulders . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: football : tns know scale of croatian challenge
text: the new saints are under no illusions about the difficulty of their champions league tie against the hnk rijeka tonight , but they are confident they can do themselves justice .
the croatian champions only lost two league games last season and the heat will be an issue on the adriatic coast , but manager scott ruscoe promised his side would be well organised .
author: Nick Southall
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: opera to be performed on baschurch farm
text: a farm workshop in baschurch might not be the usual place to stage an opera , but for one night this month it will be .

the london-based pop up opera is touring the country , putting on performances of the secret marriage in unusual locations like churches , barns and a castle and has chosen to include moor farm on 28 july .
the small company has been to moor farm before and performed the barber of seville in february .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: further delay to hospitals review
text: it will now be september at the earliest before people are consulted on plans to reorganise shropshire 's hospitals .

proposals which involve moving specialist women and children 's services to shrewsbury and downgrading telford 's a & e department were put forward at the end of last year and the shrewsbury and telford hospital trust had hoped to open them up to consultation in january .
the process has been held up because of objections raised by telford health commissioners and an independent review of the process has been carried out , to make sure mistakes were n't made .
it had been thought the consultation could start in the summer , but while the review is nearing completion , it 's not ready to be published yet .

documents.title: proposal for weekly visits to care homes by gps
text: care homes in telford could see weekly visits from gps if a proposal to health bosses gets the go-ahead .
the idea is part of a plan to try and cut down the number of people being admitted to hospital from care homes in the borough .
telford & wrekin clinical commissioning group will be asked to give the idea the go-ahead at their board meeting this afternoon .

documents.title: drugs seized from dog charity
text: the owner of a dog rehoming charity says she did n't know she was breaking the law when she bought medication for animals online .
jodie lynn runs a dog rehoming charity in shrewsbury and bought medication from abroad for dogs with a specific blood condition .
she says that she was only aware that it was a criminal offence when an officer from defra turned up with a warrant to search the premises .

documents.title: four pscos saved from budget cuts
text: funding has been found to retain four police comunity support officers in telford .
they were funded by telford and wrekin council and were due to go as part of budget cuts at the authority .
they will now continue , with town councils taking on responsibility for paying them .
the four officers will patrol dawley , madeley , oakengates , newport and wellington .

documents.title: telford company wins huge deal to provide bricks for battersea power station renovation
text: one of britain 's best-known buildings is to be renovated using bricks made in shropshire after a huge contract was won by a county company .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: football : rijeka fans confident of win over tns
text: the hnk rijeka fans are in a confident mood ahead of their champions league qualifier against the new saints tonight .
about 10,000 are expected to be at the game over in croatia and sara will be one of them .
author: Nick Southall
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: video : how much rain can we expect today ?
text: a wet day is in store for many , with patchy rain growing steadily throughout the morning and into the afternoon .
it will feel cooler than yesterday , with highs of about 15c ( 59f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning from the bbc shropshire newsroom
text: the team and i will be bringing you the latest news , sport , travel and weather between now and 18.00 .
you can comment on our stories and share your by email , facebook or twitter .
author: Les Walton
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: huge crane removes old mri scanner
text: a 230ft ( 70m ) crane has been used to remove an old mri scanner from telford 's princess royal hospital .
it was installed 12 years ago , but is being replaced by a new one later in the summer .
the crane lifted the scanner out of a courtyard , over part of the hospital and on to a lorry parked in the main public car park .

documents.title: villagers demanding answers over hs2 traffic
text: a meeting 's being held this evening for people concerned about the impact hs2 will have on their village .
some people in woore on the shropshire/staffordshire border are worried plans to widen the road - to allow waste from the construction to be taken away - will create noise and pollution .
we would actually like more information as to why the traffic containing all the materials that are excavated are coming through our village and why there are n't any better alternatives . ''

documents.title: man utd 's henderson joins shrewsbury
text: man utd 's henderson joins shrewsbury

documents.title: football : interest in tns striker quigley
text: the new saints manager scott ruscoe says there has been interest in striker scott quigley from football league and non-league clubs in england , but he hopes to keep hold of his player .
quigley scored three times over the two legs against europa fc in the champions league qualifiers and will lead the attack against hnk rijeka tomorrow night .
ruscoe says the 24-year-old has the ability to play in the english leagues , if he can stay consistent .
people are taking a look at him now and thinking 'is he worth a chance ? ' ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: weather : heavy rain forecast
text: enjoy this gloomy , oppressive cloud while you can - tomorrow we 're getting heavy rain across the west midlands .
and it 's forecast to stay through the week .
author: Rich Davis
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: new funding found to keep pcsos
text: funding has been found to retain four police comunity support officers in telford .
they were funded by telford and wrekin council and were due to go as part of budget cuts at the authority .
now they will continue , with town councils taking on responsibility for paying them .
the four officers will patrol dawley , madeley , oakengates , newport and wellington .

it 's great to see that these areas have committed to work with us and find a solution that can allow these posts , which the council could no longer afford to continue to fund long-term due to budget cuts , and the very valuable support they provide to continue . ''

documents.title: football : young goalkeeper signs on loan for shrewsbury
text: shrewsbury town have signed a goalkeeper dean henderson on a season-long loan from manchester united .
manager paul hurst knows the 20-year-old from when they worked together at grimsby town .
henderson has represented england at under-16 , under-17 and under-20 levels .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: owen paterson mp dismisses vince cable brexit claims
text: a shropshire mp has dismissed a suggestion from sir vince cable that brexit might not happen .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: man cut free from car after crash with lorry
text: a man in his 30s had to be cut free from his car by firefighters after it collided with a lorry on elson road on the outskirts of ellesmere this afternoon .
he was the driver of the vehicle and was treated for back pain by paramedics just after 13:00 .
earlier , a woman was taken to hospital with cuts to her face after her car collided with a van in a separate incident on the a5 near oswestry golf club .

documents.title: football : tns opponents see rapid growth
text: people in the town of rijeka , where the new saints play their champions league qualifier tomorrow night , say they 've seen their local club change a lot in recent years .
it was bought in 2012 by italian businessman gabriele volpi and last season the team won its first croatian championship .
christian ruvic runs boat trips from the town , along the adriatic coast and is a big hnk rijeka fan .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: shifnal 's last bank is closing
text: shifnal is losing its last bank , with barclays announcing it is shutting its branch on 20 october .

the bank said it had seen a decline in the number of customers use it and nearly two thirds of its customers had transferred to other branches - all staff will be offered jobs in other local branches .

the town is growing , with around 1,000 new homes being built , but barclays said customers would be able to do a lot of their banking at the local post office and said more were choosing to bank online .

documents.title: man in 60s beaten and robbed in shrewsbury
text: a man in his 60s has been beaten up and robbed in shrewsbury .
police say he was walking along a footpath on telford way at around 22:30 yesterday , when he was knocked to the ground .
his attacker , who was wearing dark clothing , then continued to beat him , causing injuries to his arms , legs and face , before taking jewellery and escaping on a mountain bike .

documents.title: your photos : cloud in longnor and rabbits in ludlow
text: after the heat of saturday and yesterday 's storms , we are back to thick coverings of cloud again - as you can see in this photo by bbc weather watcher peter steggles in longnor .
and his fellow weather watcher `` foggy '' took this photo of rabbits near ludlow this morning .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: appeal for new garden at hospital off to quick start
text: an appeal to raise £ 675,000 to help build a special garden for spinal patients at the orthopaedic hospital at gobowen is off to a good start and has already collected £ 126,000 .
the hospital has joined forces with the charity horatio 's garden to create the new space and will be employing bunny guinness from the bbc 's gardener 's question time to create it .
the area will be divided up into five different spaces and mr guinnness said it would be `` the most beautiful sanctuary , which will be here for years to come to enhance the stay of patients . ''
it 's hoped that work will start in autumn 2018 .

documents.title: wine producers enjoyed record 2016
text: english wine producers toasted record-breaking sales in 2016 , a new study shows .
winemakers generated £ 132m last year - up 16 % on 2015 - while a record 64 new producers obtained licences to produce wine , according to the analysis by funding options .
martin millington from the shropshire winemaker wroxeter roman vineyard said he 'd seen english wines gradually gain more of a foothold since he started 26 years ago .

he said that when he started there were fewer than 100 vineyards in this country and getting planning permission to set one up on green fields was very difficult , because the authorities classed wine-making as an industrial activity .
mr millington successfully challenged that designation and says it is a lot easier to set up a vineyard these days .

documents.title: man jailed for mother and partner attack
text: man jailed for mother and partner attack

documents.title: football : tns manager 'confident ' ahead of champions league tie
text: the new saints manager scott ruscoe says his team will `` give it a good go '' against the croatian champions hnk rijeka tomorrow night .
he took charge this summer after the departure of his record-breaking predecessor craig harrison .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: tractor rally raises over £ 2,000 for hos
text: a tractor rally at melverley yesterday has raised over £ 2,000 for severn hos
the annual event attracted 112 machines , some of them used by farmers , others restored by enthusiasts .
author: Sean Fogarty
Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: ice hockey : two more defencemen added to tigers squad
text: telford tigers have added another two players to their squad for the new nihl season - defencemen jordan stokes and dale white .
stokes played four times for coventry blaze in the elite league last season and the 18-year-old was with hull pirates before that .
white is 27 and played 54 games for tigers in the 2014-15 epl season - he has played over 100 elite league games for the blaze .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: roof tiles called out after roof tiles fall on pavement
text: firefighters were called out to a property in the old coleham area of shrewsbury yesterday evening , because roof tiles had come loose and were falling on to the pavement below .

documents.title: bridge closed for repairs
text: the fitz bridge , which carries the road from montford bridge to leaton over the river perry is going to be closed for two days .
repair work started at 09:30 this morning and traffic is being diverted via grafton and walford heath .

documents.title: bomere heath man jailed for attack on girlfriend and mother
text: a bomere heath man been given an eight year sentence at stafford crown court for stabbing his partner and hitting his mother with a baseball bat .
wayne williams , who is 54 , pleaded guilty last month to the attempted murder of his girlfriend , and wounding with intent to do grievous bodily harm to his 86-year-old mother .
author: Les Walton
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : the new saints in croatia for champions league game
text: the new saints players are in croatia , ahead of tomorrow night 's champions league tie with hnk rijeka .
the welsh champions , based in oswestry , will train behind closed doors at the rijeka stadium ( below ) this evening .
reijka won their first ever title last season , finishing above big names like dinamo zagreb and hajduk split .
we will be underdogs and they will be putting a lot of pressure on us , but you know , if we defend like we can and keep our shape then we should be ok . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: more than £ 11m to be spent on rural broadband
text: more than £ 11m is going to be spent to set up wireless broadband in rural parts of shropshire .
shropshire council says the work will take three years and the new transmitters will eventually reach 14,000 premises .

worcester-based airband community internet has been employed to carry out the work , with nearly half of the £ 11.2m coming from the government 's bduk project and the rest coming from airband , the marches local enterprise partnership and the council , which is contributing £ 2.4m .

documents.title: missed diabetes tests 'putting eyesight at risk '
text: the nhs says more than 4,000 people a year are putting their eyesight at risk in shropshire by failing to turn up for diabetic eye tests .
the shrewsbury and telford hospital trust aims to screen about 30,000 people with diabetes a year and says that problems spotted early enough can be corrected .
it says the missed appointments cost the nhs £ 90,000 a year .

documents.title: protests over maternity unit closures
text: about 300 people yesterday took part in protests against the temporary closure of three rural maternity units across shropshire , organisers say .
midwife-led units in oswestry , ludlow and bridgnorth are closed for up to six months over staffing shortages .
the shrewsbury and telford hospital nhs trust said closures are in place to `` ensure the safety of mums '' .
expectant mothers will be offered alternative locations for births .
one mother said `` no one should have to stay in a hospital too far from home '' .

documents.title: craven arms lorry driver gets 21-year ban over false records
text: a lorry driver from shropshire has been banned from professional driving for 21 years after helping a colleague falsify records .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: 'england 's longest ' diversion over
text: a near 60-mile traffic diversion on the a49 has ended as network rail completed work on the onibury railway crossing .
the work was due to take 10 days , but has been completed a day early - much to the relief of businesses and residents in south shropshire .
author: Tim Page
News Editor, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: police crackdown on drivers using mobile phones
text: about 1,000 people have been stopped for using their phones while driving over the past six months , police in west mercia and warwickshire say .
new , stricter rules were introduced earlier this year meaning you can be fined £ 200 and get six points on your licence if caught .
police say drivers stopped at red lights or queuing in traffic do n't have an excuse .

documents.title: video : your 50-second weather forecast
text: after a bright and clear start it will become cloudier with the chance of some showers this afternoon and highs of 21c ( 70f ) .
author: Mel Coles
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: good morning from the bbc shropshire newsroom
text: the team and i will be bringing you the latest news , sport , travel and weather between now and 18.00 .
you can comment on our stories and share your by email , facebook or twitter .
author: Les Walton
Journalist, BBC Shropshire
